00026 // max_char
00027 // -------------
00028  
00034 char max_char(int alpha[26]){
00035     int index = 0, max = 0;
00036     for(int i=0; i < 26; i++){
00037        if(alpha[i]>max){
00038         max = alpha[i];
00039         index = i;
00040           }
00041         }
00042      assert(index<26 && index>=0);
00043      return (char)index + (int)'a';
00044      }
00045 // -------------
00046 // max_frequency
00047 // -------------
00048  
00059 char max_frequency (const char* b, const char* e) {
00060     assert(b < e);
00061     char temp ; int index; 
00062     int alpha[26] = {0}; // array to represent all the 26 letters of alphabet
00063     while (b != e){
00064         if (std::isalpha(*b)){
00065         temp = std::tolower(*b);
00066         index = (int)(temp)-(int)'a'; //add the count of the char into the corresponding index at the array
00067         alpha[index]++; //increment the value inside the array
00068         }
00069     b++; //move the ptr forward
00070     }
00071     char max = max_char(alpha);
00072     assert(max >='a' && max <= 'z');
00073     return max;}
00074 
00075 // ------
00076 // rotate
00077 // ------
00078 
00090 void rotate (char* b, char* e, int r) {
00091     r = r % 26; //truncate r so  r < 26
00092     assert(b < e);
00093     while(b!=e){
00094         char& c = *b;  // use c as an alias of b
00095         if(std::isalpha(c)){ //check if it's an alphabetical character
00096            if(std::isupper(c)){
00097            c = c + r;
00098              if((int)c>'Z') c = c - 26;  //check if it's out of bound and then restore it
00099              else if((int)c<'A') c = c +26;
00100            }
00101            else if(std::islower(c)){
00102            c = c + r;
00103              if((int)c>'z') c = c - 26;
00104              else if((int)c<'a') c = c + 26;
00105            }
00106         }
00107     b++; //incrementing the pointer
00108     }
00109    }
